scenarios.title: Hurricane Relief
scenarios.description: Lead an emergency response team in a city devastated by a hurricane. Your choices will determine the direction and impact of your relief efforts.

prompts.text: A flooded neighborhood is in desperate need of help. How will you approach the rescue?
Resources are running low in the shelters. What's your next move?
Injured survivors are arriving faster than medical staff can treat them. What do you prioritize?
Local volunteers want to help but lack training. How do you involve them?
A second storm is forecasted to hit soon. How do you prepare?

answers.text: Lead the rescue personally, risking dangerous conditions.
Form a team of volunteer heroes and push into the hardest-hit area.
Wait for first responders with proper gear before entering.
Coordinate with local authorities to redirect resources.
Organize a community meeting and assign roles.
Set up a triage tent to prioritize critical patients.
Use social media to crowdsource supplies.
Reassure everyone that help is on the way.
Evacuate vulnerable areas before the next storm arrives.
Double emergency drills for all shelter staff.
